intro: Hesperis matronalis subsp. hortensis, commonly known as the garden honesty, is a flowering plant native to Europe. It produces clusters of white, four-petaled flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are dark green and slightly hairy. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden borders. Its ornamental value comes from its delicate flowers and long-lasting seed pods.
